Generation IV.Diamond: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines if endangered.
Generation IV.Platinum: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
Generation IV.HeartGold: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it's in trouble.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it's in trouble.

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.
Generation VIII.Shield: Electricity makes this Pokémon's fur glow. Shinx sends signals to others of its kind by shaking the tip of its tail while the tail tip is shining brightly.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines when it is in danger.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
Generation IX.Violet: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it's in trouble.
